intro: Backeria barbata, commonly known as the hairy backeria, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
